pageContext.claim: “Illegal immigration costs our nation $275 billion a year -- you hear many different numbers. You can say 'billions and billions.' But the number that I hear most accurate is $275 billion a year, at least -- millions of jobs and thousands of innocent lives.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump has often claimed illegal immigration cost more than $100 billion, but recently he began to say $200 billion. Now, it's suddenly $275 billion. Trump appears to be relying on a study by the Federation for American Immigration Reform, which opposes immigration and has been criticized for its methodology, which critics say overstates costs and understates benefits. The FAIR report comes up with a annual $135 billion annual cost by using a high-end estimate for the number of undocumented immigrants and counting the benefits consumed by the children of illegal immigrants born in the U.S., who under law are U.S. citizens – but not the fiscal impact of the children of unauthorized immigrants once they become adults. Other analysts say the cost of illegal immigration is much lower, likely not more than 1/10th the FAIR figure.
